intro: Verbesina corral-diazii, commonly known as the Corral-Díaz beggar's ticks, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. Its leaves are typically alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine, hair-like structures. Verbesina corral-diazii is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils and along dry streambeds.
